intro: Eulophia shupangae, commonly known as the Shupangae orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structure. The plant typically features dark green, strap-like leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Eulophia shupangae thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
